definitions.definition: The state of forgetting completely, of being oblivious, unconscious, unaware, as when sleeping, drunk, or dead.
definitions.example: He regularly drank himself into oblivion.

definitions.definition: The state of being completely forgotten, of being reduced to a state of non-existence, extinction, or nothingness, incl. through war and destruction. (Figuratively) for an area like hell, a wasteland.
definitions.example: Due to modern technology, many more people and much more information will not slip into oblivion, contrary to what happened throughout history until now.

definitions.definition: To consign to oblivion; to efface utterly.
